page.title: 20Football hooliganism
page.content: A social concern is something that the whole community is worried about.The{ {media}emphasise the concern about behaviour of football fans. The government is concerned about keeping{ {law and order}in and around football grounds before, during and after matches. The clubs are encouraged by the government to take responsible{ {attitudes}and help the police to catch hooligans. Clubs have installed video cameras to scan the crowd to identify trouble makers and the police can arrest them. To prevent invasion of the pitch it was suggested that the clubs should enclose the fans with wire fencing. However, after a recent disasterous fire in a stand this would be safety hazard. Alcohol is banned in Scottish grounds and as a result fans seem to be better behaved.
